intro: Ixora barberae, commonly known as the Jamaica ixora, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental species. Its evergreen leaves are glossy and provide a striking contrast to its vibrant flowers. Ixora barberae is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
